column2: CONNECTICUT DMV PERMIT TEST
column6: CT

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Drivers should change lanes:
column6: gradually and carefully.
column8: often.

column2: 2. When the road is slippery, you should:
column6: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column8: pump your brakes.

column2: 3. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column6: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column8: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.

column2: 4. To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
column6: drive at a constant speed.
column8: apply the brakes firmly.

column2: 5. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column6: in an exit lane.
column8: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.

column2: 6. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column6: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column8: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.

column2: 7. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column6: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 8. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: reduce their speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: closely follow the driver in front of them.
column8: maintain their speed through the work zone.

column2: 9. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column6: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column8: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.

column2: 10. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column6: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column8: should not speed up or brake quickly.

column2: 11. The use of alcohol and/or drugs affects:
column6: concentration and reaction time.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 12. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You may turn in in the direction of the arrowÂ after coming to a complete stop.
column6: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column8: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.

column2: 13. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column6: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 14. Who is most at risk?
column6: Experienced drivers.
column8: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 15. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column6: you increase the chance of a crash.
column8: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 16. When driving on a roadway with a single broken white line:
column4: you may cross the broken white line to change lanes.
column6: you may not cross the broken white line.
column8: you may change lanes only if you are in the right lane.

column2: 17. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column6: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column8: having them checked by a mechanic.

column2: 18. A flashing red light:
column4: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column6: is used at dangerous intersections.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 19. This sign indicates that:
column4: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column6: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column8: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.

column2: 20. Your driving ability can be affected by:
column6: at least two drinks.
column8: just one drink.

column2: 21. This road sign means the road you're driving on:
column4: turns sharply to the left and then right
column6: turns to the right and then the left
column8: turns only to the left

column2: 22. If you drive too fast on a wet road:
column4: other drivers will consider you an aggressive driver.
column6: your tires may start to glide over the water.
column8: your ability to judge speed will be impaired.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column8: A road crosses the main highway ahead.

column2: 24. Drivers who are 16 or 17 years of age are not permitted to use any type of:
column6: cell phone.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 25. To safely return to your lane after passing another vehicle, you should:
column6: see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.
column8: flash your headlights.
